Reviews.Content: Wonderful Stay You won't be disappointed if you stay here!Wonderful location, very nice apartment, just a lovely stay overall. Also, Francesca gave us wonderful restaurant recommendations and advice.I would stay here again without hesitation.
Reviews.Author: TravelGirl55

Reviews.Content: Terrific place to stay My family stayed at Palazzo Alfani for 5 nights at the end of October. As the other reviewers have commented, the property is well-appointed, clean, and elegant. The hospitality of the owner is terrific. My two children slept on the pull-out sofa bed, and found it perfectly comfortable. The kitchen is well-equipped with everything you could need for a short stay (and then some). The bathroom has a Jacuzzi shower (but our room had no bath tub, if that matters to anyone). The location is perfect, and we walked almost everywhere. It's close to a bus stop, if you want to ride up to Fiesole (which you should by the way) for a great view of the city. The owner was helpful in every way. As an added bonus, Ernesto -- the owner's black cat -- also showed a great deal of hospitality to my children. We departed early morning for a drive to Siena, and the owner gave us two pieces of delicious cake for the children. What service! We would definitely choose this hotel/apartment again.
Reviews.Author: Expat-in-Geneva

Reviews.Content: Superb Accomodation Palazzo Alfani is a superb residence located right outside Galleria Accademia. We spend only 2 nights in the 4-room San Giovani Apartment but the impressions are the best. The Apartment was very clean and the hospitality worth to be mentioned. Siniora Francesca Alfani, the owner, was very polite and helpful and she made great efforts to enjoy our days there. Do not hesitate to ask her for tips (places to go, to eat etc).For travellers not willing to leave their office behind, a reliable high speed internet access is available free of charge. Highly recommended!
Reviews.Author: ozcraft

Reviews.Content: An Absolute Gem My husband and I spent 7 days at the Palazzo Alfani and were aboslutely delighted with our experience. Signora Alfani (Francesca) was a wonderful hostess, making us feel at home and assuring that all our needs were met. The apartment itself was lovely with an interior design that reflectst the owners love for the property (Signora Alfani and her family live on site). We would definitely stay here again and recommend it at the highest level to others seeking a truly wonderful experience in Florence.Rebecca and Dan
Reviews.Author: RGKSC

Reviews.Author: Sibellasmom

Reviews.Content: beautiful apartment in florence Of all our terrific accommodations during our 3-week trip to Europe this summer, the Palazzo Alfani has to be our absolute favorite! The location, right across the street from the Accademia Museum (home of David), was ideal -- not too crammed with tourists, but not too far away from the sights. We walked up a few flights of stairs to a quiet and gorgeous apartment (the San Marco) with dramatic, high ceilings, luxurious draperies and colorful frescoes on the ceiling. The bathroom was pristine and modern with a great shower -- no small thing in Europe! Best of all, perhaps, was our attentive and friendly hostess Francesca -- she was so helpful and lovely. If you're looking for a place that'll make you feel like a Florence resident, rather than a tourist, this is it! My husband, 8 year-old daughter and I would recommend it to everyone.
Reviews.Author: amywriter

Reviews.Content: Fabulous Apartment  26th September to 1st OctoberWhen we arrived at Palazzo Alfani, my husband and 2 daughters aged 8 and 10 were absolutely delighted with the apartment. It was across the road from the Accademia, but on the quiet side, not on the road side which would have been much noisier. Francesca, who looked after us was lovely and even organised tickets for us to see David and to enter the Uffizi Gallery. Francesca Alfani, who was the owner, lived next door and went out of her way to make us feel at home, she even sent me to her hairdresser. The apartment had just been refurbished with antiques, the kitchen was well stocked with cutlery, china and pots, the bathroom was spacious and spotless with a massage shower just installed. We would highly recommend it for families with children. It was central to shops and restaurants and attractions. Wouldn't even contemplate a 4.5 start hotel. Would definitely stay here again. Just superb!
Reviews.Author: WandererMelbourne

Reviews.Content: Living like a local...priceless... My husband and I spent 4 nights at the Palazzo Alfani. All I have to say is that 4 nights was not long enough! This little apartment residence, located directly across from the Accademia, is an absolute gem. There is no lobby, no concierge, no bell boys...which in my opinion adds even more to it's charm. What you will find is a warm, inviting apartment, lovingly run by Francesca and the Alfani family who will look after your every need without hesitation and with a smile to boot!The Alfani has an amazing location...directly across the Accademia and an approx 10 - 15 min walk to the Duomo, Piazza della Republica, etc. It is the perfect location to explore. There are also several restaurants in the area. Francesca has some of the most amazing recommendations...I highly recommend you try one or all of them. Our favourite was the 'Accademia' Enoteca which was just around the corner from the apartment. The apartments are very well appointed. We stayed in the Santa Maria Novella suite which overlooked Via Ricasoli and the entrance to the Accademia. The line for the Accademia is long and starts early...if you are sensitive to noise, recommend a room that faces the inside courtyard garden. We actually did not mind the noise from the street...it added charm and actually forced us to wake up early to head out and explore.Each apartment has its own kitchenette (equiped with everything you need) as well as a lovely sitting and eating area. The rooms are immaculate! Not to mention the high ceilings and impressive decoration! There is a small grocery store only a few steps away where you can get everything you need...including wine!What else can I say? The Palazzo Alfani is an incredible find in amazing Firenze. If you are looking for accommodation that is a little more under the tourist radar than a typical hotel...look no further. The apartments at the Palazzo Alfani will make you feel like your home away from home...and Francesca will go out of her way to help with anything. She is amazing!Francesca...Thank you so much for making our stay with you our most memorable in Italia. We look forward to staying with you again soon...and I look forward to recommending your residence to all my clients! John and Tricia...your friends in Canada.Oh...and if you are looking for something off the beaten path to do while in Firenze...I highly recommend the 1-day Bike Tuscany tour with ArtViva tours...it was fantastic and the highlight of our trip (aside from the Palazzo Alfani of course)...
Reviews.Author: born2travel3

Reviews.Content: Apartment Living on Vacation Rather than staying at a hotel on my last trip to Florence, Italy, I decided to rent an apartment. Palazzo Alfani al David is so conveniently located and is literally right across the street from the Academia and around the corner from Piazza San Marco. My expectations of the apartment were throughly exceeded. It was bright, airy, very spacious, immaculately clean, very nicely furnished and I immediately felt at home. Huge windows in the living room/dining room combination opened to a beautiful courtyard, as did the bedroom window. The bathroom was very large with all modern plumbing and a fabulous shower. The kitchen was furnished with a refrigerator, stove, microwave, coffee maker and coffee! There was a large flat screen TV and very high speed internet access that simply required being plugged into my laptop. Florence is such a fabulous city that you want to walk it over and over again....it is truly a walking city. It was wonderful to return home to my apartment for an afternoon rest after all my walking each day. And then out to dinner. I even had two occasions when I had a delicious meal that I couldn't finish and I took home a doggie bag that I was able to heat in the microwave another day! Francesca, the proprietor, couldn't do enough for me. She was terrific. I plan to make Palazzo Alfani my second home when I return to Florence each year!!
Reviews.Author: CaraFirenze

Reviews.Content: Superb!! Location, location, location. In this perfect spot for walking to allFlorence's historical sites, we spent five days in February, 2008.Our superb 2-room apartment overlooked the entrance to theAccademia Museum and had a view of the Duomo.The English-speaking Alfani family, who reside at the newlyrenovated and impeccably clean and neat place, were availableto assist us with advice about the area, including history,restaurants, shopping, and marketing. They couldn't have beenmore helpful. Mrs. Alfani even offered to send a personalmoney wire when my credit card mistankenly included the billtwice on my account. That wasn't necessary as she managed to have the bill corrected quickly.Having traveled in Italy and elsewhere often, I can't praise thislovely spot enough. I'm looking forward to our next visit,perhaps during the winter of 2009.
Reviews.Author: BostonLadies

Reviews.Content: A romantic place Me and my wife stayed at Palazzo Alfani in late August 2007 on our honeymoon trip.I must say, this is a very beautiful place, with a very helpful and kind landlady Franceska, who was always eager to meet our needs. Perfect location and decoration, this really is a very romantic placeto stop by in Florence. We even made a renaissance-style photo session in the beautiful interiors of our San Marco apprtment. Among disadvantages i'd indicate absence of room service (though thisis common for apartments, as they position themselves) and noise fromthe street if you windows look at the entrance to Academia museum entrance. A clamouring queue usually appears at 8 am, so forget aboutlong sleep in the morning. Booking apartment with windows looking to the quiet inner garden is the only decisions for those who likes to sleep long. ;)
Reviews.Author: Denisko

Reviews.Content: florence dream We just came back from palazzo alfani with our two girls 4 and 8 Y/O. This was one of the best places we ever stayed and we did some fine hotels all arround the world. When you arrive you will meet the lovely Alfani lady which will do everything so you enjoy your stay, one true nice lovely lady that goes down to the smallest details when it comes to her guests comforts.The apartments are truely amazing, tastefully designed and equipped with all the comforts. You will certainly feel in a Palazzo, no doubt. the location is perfect and you have everything you may need in no less then few steps. if you want to feel like a local while being a tourist, then its for you. we will certainly reccomend this to all the people we know.
Reviews.Author: david209

Reviews.Content: Palazoo Alfani is a gem We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at Palazzo Alfani. The location is perfect - directly across the street from the Aacadmia - a quick stroll to the Duomo and all else that glorious Florence has to offer. The apartment itself was newly, and very tastefully appointed with a lot of attention to detail paid to the things that matter. Street noise was non existent as the apartment we had windows which opened out above an adjacent internal courtyard. The management are charming - friendly and very helpful. I cannot recommend it enough!
Reviews.Author: KMPLondon

Reviews.Content: Great place, Excellent Location, Wonderful Owners My wife and our 8 month old baby stayed at the Palazzo Alfani in May of 2007. You couldn't pick a better place to stay in Florence. The location is perfect. You are literally right across the narrow street from the Accademia, and only 2 blocks from the Duomo.The apartment was completely renovated very recently and it looked great. The bathroom and showers were superb, the living room very comfortable and the flat screen LCD a nice touch.To top it off, the owner, her husband, and their adorable little boy couldn't be more accommodating and helpful. If you are looking for a place in Florence, I would highly recommend this comfortable apartment.
Reviews.Author: FordFair

Reviews.Author: pjjc

Reviews.Content: Such a great find Me, a 22 yr old girl, my sister, 24, and my two aunties just got back from a four-day trip to Florence, Italy and it was fab. We stayed at the Palazzo Alfani, a small family run establishment, with a series of self-contained apartments.The Alfani family, who run it, were absolutely brilliant, they were so kind, and would go out of their way to be helpful and left no stone unturned. We can鈥檛 praise them highly enough and we would definitely recommend this as a place to stay.The location is second to none, right opposite the Accademia Gallery with the Duomo at the end of the road, which sadly we didn't have time to queue for, but was stunning and surreal to look at, and it鈥檚 no more than a 10 minute walk to the Santa Novella station. The rooms are recently refurbished (we were lucky enough to be their first-ever guests), they are traditional, yet modern, clean and bright with well-equipped kitchens. However, we did have a room overlooking the Accademia Gallery (which houses Michaelangelo's 'David') and it does get a little noisy at around 8am with queues of people. Not a problem for us, but if you prefer something a bit quieter just request an apartment overlooking the pretty garden.If you do want to go to the Accademia Gallery, it's advisable to get there no later than 8am, otherwise you could end up queuing round the block. Alternatively, you can always queue in the morning and get tickets for later in the day, which we found useful. Be warned, it is closed on a Monday. Tickets are around 9 Euros.We also visited the Boboli Gardens, which were gorgeous, they had sculptures and the higher you go the better the views of Florence are. We got some lovely photos. Queues are long, but they go down quite quickly, so it's worth waiting. Tickets were 6 Euros and included in that you get entry to some of the Museums on the site, which consisted of costumes, pottery, paintings, and sculptures.The Ponte Vecchio was well worth visiting too, it had lovely picturesque views and to get there from the town centre you encounter a quaint little street with more jewellery shops than you can shake a stick at! Also nearby (a block west of Piazza Sante Croce), there is a fab little ice cream shop called 'Vivoli', it's difficult to find, but worth it when you get there! They have so many unusual flavours and each one we tried was delicious.Depending on what sort of shopping you like we were amazed with the markets, they were all willing to barter and you can get some real bargains, such as beautifully soft leather bags, pashmenas, t-shirts and costume jewellery. However, the sales people can be a bit overbearing. If you were looking to go to a shopping outlet, we do not recommend Barberino, even though it is only a 30 minute bus journey, we were unimpressed. The items were hardly discounted and the shops were rather understocked. For us it was a wasted afternoon.On the whole Florence was one of the best short breaks we have been on, and we鈥檝e been on quite a few now. We recommend the Palazzo Alfani apartments with no hesitation. In fact, we're hoping to stay there again later this year, but this time we'll certainly join that queue for the Duomo!
Reviews.Author: JLorettaB
